hints.content:
We want to put the largest digit in the highest place value. 

Which digit is the largest?

$\maroonD9$ is the largest digit, and we want to put it in the position with the highest place value.   

  So $\maroonD9$ will be in the thousands place: 
 $\maroonD{9}{,}$ $\_$ $\_$ $\_$

Now we need to do the same thing with the next largest digit:  $\blueD9$.  

  So  $\blueD9$ goes in the hundreds place:  

$\maroonD{9}{,}$$\blueD9$ $\_$ $\_$

The next largest digit is the $\greenD8$.  The $\greenD8$ goes in the place to the right of hundreds--the tens place:  

$\maroonD{9}{,}$$\blueD9$$\greenD8$  $\_$

The smallest digit is the $\purpleC5$.  The  $\purpleC5$ goes in the ones place:  

$\maroonD{9}{,}\blueD9\greenD8\purpleC5$

The greatest possible number we can make is $\maroonD{9}{,}\blueD9\greenD8\purpleC5$.

question.content:
**Arrange the digits $9,5,8$ and $9$ to create the greatest possible four-digit number.**
